SENT.plain: The role of thrombolysis in brain ischemia in patients with atrial myxoma is unknown
A patient with acute brain ischemia and previously undiagnosed atrial myxoma recanalized an occluded middle cerebral artery with intra-arterial thrombolysis
Arterial occlusion from presumed myxoma may be amenable to fibrinolysis
Angiography before treatment in patients with atrial myxoma excludes a myxomatous pseudoaneurysm and permits site-specific thrombolytic instillment
